questions.text: How many days did Andy say that the CODEL had been in Gaza?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Andy was part of the CODEL (Congressional Delegation) that went to Gaza. As they were boarding the cars to leave Gaza, Andy remarked on how they had been in Gaza four days and her body still hadn't acclimated to the time adjustment.

questions.text: Before the explosion happened, who was the last person to speak?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Admiral Fitzwallace was teasing Donna about her relationship with the photographer named Colin. He wanted to know what line they used now to get a girl up their room. Donna was in the middle of telling him when the explosion occurred.

questions.text: When Leo and Kate were telling the President about the casualties, who did they NOT mention?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Leo was so stricken that he couldn't speak so Kate told the president about Congressman DeSantos and Korb being killed. Leo was the one that told the President that Admiral Fitzwallace had died in the explosion. To that remark, President Bartlett said, "I asked Fitz to go."

questions.text: When Leo first asked Josh if he wanted to go to Germany, did Josh accept?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Leo asked Josh twice if he wanted to go to Germany. Josh refused at first citing that they needed him at the White House. When Leo asked a second time, Josh walked out of the Mural room, grabbed his backpack, and left the White House for Germany.

questions.text: When Will asked Josh about Donna's condition, what adjective did Will use to describe Donna's bleeding issues?
questions.explanation:
Dire.

	Will met Josh in the lobby and asked him about Donna's condition. Josh told him there was blood loss and Will asked if it was dire. Josh said it was significant. As the group got larger, Josh finally stopped and said he would talk to everyone at once.

questions.text: Where did Kate Harper say she met Admiral Fitzwallace for the first time?
options: Situation Room at the White House
questions.explanation:
Annapolis.

	The president called Kate in and was talking with her about Admiral Fitzwallace. Kate said she met Fitz at Annapolis and he liked her insubordination when it wasn't directed toward him. The president invited Kate to go with him to see Mrs. Fitzwallace.

questions.text: What was the name of Admiral Fitzwallace's widow?
questions.explanation:
Gail.

	Mrs. Fitzwallace's name has changed over the years, but this is the name that the president called her. The president took Kate with him when he went to see her to express his condolences.

questions.text: How many children did Leo tell CJ were killed in the missile strike on an apartment building in Gaza?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	The missile strike was supposed to kill a Hamas leader. Among the twelve dead were four children. Leo told CJ that no word had come in if the Hamas leader that was targeted was among the dead. Leo called the president while they were coming back from the home of Mrs. Fitzwallace.

questions.text: Of what rock group did Donna say Colin, the photographer, was a fan?
questions.explanation:
Aerosmith.

	The first thing Colin said to Donna when he met her was a line from an Aerosmith song. The line was, "Same old story, same old song and dance".

questions.text: What was the last name of the doctor that talked with Josh about Donna in Germany?
questions.explanation:
Leahy.

	The doctor told Josh about Donna's injuries and then took care of him when Josh got queasy. The doctor's first name was never heard, but he was seen again in the second part titled "Memorial Day".
